intro: Monotrema bracteatum, commonly known as the bracteate monotrema, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae, or grass family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers that are typically green or pale in color. It is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Monotrema bracteatum is adapted to a variety of soil types and is relatively drought-tolerant.
